Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading higher on heightened tensions following an attack on a Saudi Arabian oil field by Iran. NOTE: The strike on the oil field has disrupted about half of Saudi Arabia's oil production equivalent to 5% of the daily global oil supply.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower after as a potential push-back after the sector trading higher for the last three consecutive sessions on news that OPEC and other countries would agree to extend oil output cuts to support prices. NOTE: Saudi Arabia wants to boost oil prices for the upcoming Aramco IPO in an effort to balance its budget and pull off a $2 trillion valuation.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading higher after the new Saudi energy minister said there would be no radical change in the country's oil policy and the deal to cut oil production by 1.2 million barrels per day will stay.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading higher after the EIA reported a crude inventory draw of 4.771 million compared to the 2.488 million draw estimate. A larger-than-expected draw is seen as a sign of oil demand increasing.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower as trade concerns continue to escalate following a new 15% tariff, which was added by President Trump to $112 billion worth of Chinese goods on Sunday.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading lower as Hurricane Dorian inches closer toward Florida, which could potentially lower demand.

Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading higher amid easing trade tensions. China's Ministry of Commerce said the country is willing to calmly resolve the trade dispute with the USA and is against any further escalation in tensions.
Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower as investors fear a slowing global economy.
Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower in sympathy with the overall market. Crude oil inventories showed a 2.39 million build, compared to the 3.313 million draw estimate.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher following large US crude inventory draws.
Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher in anticipation of a potential Federal Reserve rate cut tomorrow.
Dril-Quip shares are trading higher after the company reported Q2 EPS and sales results higher from last year.
Dril-Quip Q2 EPS $0.05 Up From $(0.08) YoY, Sales $104M Up From $94.9M YoY

Shares of several Oil and Gas companies are trading lower as concerns that the global economy could be slowing outweigh news of an agreement by OPEC and allies, including Russia, to extend supply cuts until next March.
Shares of oil companies are trading lower after IEA cut 2019 oil demand growth forecasts and said it expects non-OPEC supply rising in 2020.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher amid eased trade tensions after China's Commerce Ministry stated they are open to dialogue to resolve trade tensions. Mexican officials also said they could find common ground with the US.

Shares of many oil and gas companies are trading lower after companies in the industry struggle to secure new investment funds following a couple of fund managers reorienting their priorities towards alternative forms of energy.
Shares of many oil and gas companies are trading higher as crude oil has remained largely over $63 per barrel for the last four sessions.
Shares of many oil and gas companies are trading higher as crude oil has remained mostly over $63 per barrel for the last four sessions.
Shares of several oil companies are trading lower as continued US-China trade tensions cause concern over global demand outlook.
